"Once a local shipping lane freighter, this model has been converted for use in debris field mining and salvage operations."
# PREFLIGHT CHECKLIST
## 1. Power supply
## 1.1. Battery units
- Check that the SMES unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the substation unit is anchored to the floor. - Check that the APC unit's Main Breaker is toggled on. - Check the APC units current Load* (W).
## 1.2. P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit
- Check that P.A.C.M.A.N. generator units are anchored to the floor. - Check that P.A.C.M.A.N. generator units are fueled. For extended flights make sure that you have enough fuel stockpiled to sustain prolonged power generation. - Check that P.A.C.M.A.N. generator units are set to HV output. - Set Target Power to 14-15** [bold]kW[/bold] on each generator unit. - Start P.A.C.M.A.N. generator units.
## 2. Atmospherics
## 2.1. Distribution Loop
- Check that the air canister is anchored to connector port. - Check that the distribution pump is set to 101kPa. - Enable the distribution pump (under the catwalk by the air canister).
## 2.2. Waste Loop
- Enable waste loop pump. - Disable Auto Mode on the Air Alarm in the Engine Room. - Set the Air Alarm in the Engine Room to Filtering (Wide).
## 3. Other checks
- Check that the gyroscope is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the mini gravity generator is anchored, powered, and enabled. - Check that the bow blast doors are closed.
## Sidenotes
* - Kestrel-class salvage ships are equipped with five APC units that can be used to appraise the ship's total power consumption. Unmodifued Kestrel-class ship requires 27.6 kW of power to remain operational.
** - Kestrel-class salvage ships have higher power demand than single standard P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit can provide at optimal settings, however the ship comes equipped with two P.A.C.M.A.N. generator units, recommended target power output for each P.A.C.M.A.N. generator unit is 15 kW.
